main.name: Rathi Kashi
main.description: I am currently pursuing a Masters in Computer Science at Duke University
main.bio: I like to sing, solve puzzles and play Ultimate Frisbee, not necessarily in that order. My primary areas of interest in Computer Science are Computer Security and Machine Learning. For my undergraduate thesis, I worked on Implementing Fast and Secure Garbled Circuits for Secure Two Party Computation.

resume.skillmessage: Some of the skills I picked up in my undergraduate.

education.description: Courses in progress: Blockchain Consensus, Theory and Algorithmic Machine Learning and Introduction to Algorithms.

education.degree: Post Graduate Diploma in Advanced Studies and Research in Computer Science
education.description: I completed an advanced major in Computer Science where I presented a thesis on 'FORGE: A fast online runtime for garbled circuit evaluation' and took courses in Blockchain, Advanced Algorithms, Web Data Modelling, Calculus and Statistical Inference.

I attend Ashoka University, a pioneering liberal arts college in India where I majored in Computer Science. I took courses in Theory of Computation, Big Data, Computer Security and Privacy, Advanced Machine Learning, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Operating Systems, Computer Networks, Programming Languages Design and Implementation, Advanced Programming, Linear Algebra, Discrete Mathematics. I am currently in my senior year completing an Advanced Major in Computer Science where I plan to do a few more courses along with a thesis.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Currently a Teaching Assistant for Digital Humanities under Prof. Johannes Burgers, an interdisciplinary course offered by the Computer Science and English Departments.

work.title: Technical Intern
work.description: Curate a data corpus that would be trained using Deep learning algorithms. Creating workflows and customer journies for several business verticals. Designing widgets to be used in the workflows using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Served as a Teaching Assistant for a core computer science course, Discrete Mathematics under Prof. Goutam Paul, where I was involved in assisting the professor in curating assignments and grading a class of 100 students. Conducting office hours and sessions to tutor students on concepts in the subject.

projects.title: RAKSHA-FORGE
projects.category: A JavaScript based implementation of Garbled Circuits for Secure Two Party Computation

projects.title: Neural Machine Translation
projects.category: An LSTM encoder-decoder based model for machine translation from English to Hindi with Attention

projects.title: Genesis Trail
projects.category: A distributed Hyperledger Fabric full-stack application for Organic Food Traceability
